Jason Bateman was born on January 14, 1969, in Rye, New York, to Paul and Joyce Bateman. His father was a business executive, and his mother was a former actress. Jason grew up in a family that valued the arts, and he began acting at a young age, making his stage debut in a local production of "Annie" at the age of 10.

After high school, Jason moved to Los Angeles to pursue a career in acting. He quickly landed a recurring role on the popular TV show "Silver Spoons" and later became a series regular on the sitcom "It's Your Move."

In the early 1990s, Jason began to transition to film, landing roles in movies such as "Juno" and "The Break-Up." His breakthrough role came in 2004 when he starred as Michael Bluth in the critically acclaimed TV series "Arrested Development." The show ran for three seasons and earned Jason a Golden Globe nomination for Best Actor in a Television Series - Musical or Comedy.

In addition to his work on "Arrested Development," Jason has appeared in numerous films, including "Horrible Bosses," "Identity Thief," and "This Is Where I Leave You." He has also lent his voice to animated films like "Zootopia" and "The Lego Movie 2: The Second Part."

Throughout his career, Jason has been recognized for his versatility and range as an actor. He has been nominated for multiple awards, including an Emmy and a Golden Globe, and has won several Critics' Choice Awards and Screen Actors Guild Awards.

Jason is married to actress Amanda Anka, and they have two daughters together. Despite his success, he remains committed to his family and is often seen at his daughters' school events and sports games.

In his free time, Jason enjoys playing the guitar and writing music. He has released several songs and has even performed at benefit concerts for various charitable organizations.

Overall, Jason Bateman is a talented and dedicated actor who has made a lasting impact on the entertainment industry. With his quick wit, charming on-screen presence, and impressive range, he continues to be one of the most beloved and respected actors of his generation.
